segment.source: Add drivers to a Windows 10 deployment with Windows PE using Configuration Manager (Windows 10)
segment.target: Add drivers to a Windows 10 deployment with Windows PE using Configuration Manager (Windows 10)

segment.source: In this topic, you will learn how to configure the Windows Preinstallation Environment (Windows PE) to include the network drivers required to connect to the deployment share and the storage drivers required to see the local storage on machines.
segment.target: In this topic, you will learn how to configure the Windows Preinstallation Environment (Windows PE) to include the network drivers required to connect to the deployment share and the storage drivers required to see the local storage on machines.

segment.source: Add drivers to a Windows 10 deployment with Windows PE using Configuration Manager
segment.target: Add drivers to a Windows 10 deployment with Windows PE using Configuration Manager

segment.source: Applies to
segment.target: Applies to

segment.source: Windows 10
segment.target: Windows 10

segment.source: In this topic, you will learn how to configure the Windows Preinstallation Environment (Windows PE) to include the network drivers required to connect to the deployment share and the storage drivers required to see the local storage on machines.
segment.target: In this topic, you will learn how to configure the Windows Preinstallation Environment (Windows PE) to include the network drivers required to connect to the deployment share and the storage drivers required to see the local storage on machines.

segment.source: Even though the Windows PE boot image and the Windows 10 operating system contain many out-of-the-box drivers, it is likely you will have to add new or updated drivers to support all your hardware.
segment.target: Even though the Windows PE boot image and the Windows 10 operating system contain many out-of-the-box drivers, it is likely you will have to add new or updated drivers to support all your hardware.

segment.source: In this section, you import drivers for both Windows PE and the full Windows 10 operating system.
segment.target: In this section, you import drivers for both Windows PE and the full Windows 10 operating system.

segment.source: For the purposes of this topic, we will use CM01, a machine running Windows Server 2012 R2 Standard that is a member of the domain contoso.com for the fictitious Contoso Corporation.
segment.target: For the purposes of this topic, we will use CM01, a machine running Windows Server 2012 R2 Standard that is a member of the domain contoso.com for the fictitious Contoso Corporation.

segment.source: For more details on the setup for this topic, please see Deploy Windows 10 with the Microsoft Deployment Toolkit.
segment.target: For more details on the setup for this topic, please see Deploy Windows 10 with the Microsoft Deployment Toolkit.

segment.source: Add drivers for Windows PE
segment.target: Add drivers for Windows PE

segment.source: This section will show you how to import some network and storage drivers for Windows PE.
segment.target: This section will show you how to import some network and storage drivers for Windows PE.

segment.source: This section assumes you have downloaded some drivers to the E:SourcesOSDDriverSourcesWinPE x64 folder on CM01.
segment.target: This section assumes you have downloaded some drivers to the E:SourcesOSDDriverSourcesWinPE x64 folder on CM01.

segment.source: On CM01, using the Configuration Manager Console, in the Software Library workspace, right-click the Drivers node and select Import Driver.
segment.target: On CM01, using the Configuration Manager Console, in the Software Library workspace, right-click the Drivers node and select Import Driver.

segment.source: In the Import New Driver Wizard, on the Specify a location to import driver page, below the Import all drivers in the following network path (UNC) option, browse to the CM01Sources$OSDDriverSourcesWinPE x64 folder and click Next.
segment.target: In the Import New Driver Wizard, on the Specify a location to import driver page, below the Import all drivers in the following network path (UNC) option, browse to the CM01Sources$OSDDriverSourcesWinPE x64 folder and click Next.

segment.source: On the Specify the details for the imported driver page, click Categories, create a category named WinPE x64, and then click Next.
segment.target: On the Specify the details for the imported driver page, click Categories, create a category named WinPE x64, and then click Next.

segment.source: On the Select the packages to add the imported driver page, click Next.
segment.target: On the Select the packages to add the imported driver page, click Next.

segment.source: On the Select drivers to include in the boot image page, select the Zero Touch WinPE x64 boot image.
segment.target: On the Select drivers to include in the boot image page, select the Zero Touch WinPE x64 boot image.

segment.source: Also select the Update distribution points when finished check box, and click Next twice.
segment.target: Also select the Update distribution points when finished check box, and click Next twice.

segment.source: figure 21
segment.target: figure 21

segment.source: Figure 21.
segment.target: Figure 21.

segment.source: Add drivers to Windows PE.
segment.target: Add drivers to Windows PE.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: The Updating Boot Image part of the wizard will appear to hang when displaying Done.
segment.target: The Updating Boot Image part of the wizard will appear to hang when displaying Done.

segment.source: It will complete in a minute or two.
segment.target: It will complete in a minute or two.

segment.source: Add drivers for Windows 10
segment.target: Add drivers for Windows 10

segment.source: This section illustrates how to add drivers for Windows 10 through an example in which you want to import Windows 10 drivers for the HP EliteBook 8560w model.
segment.target: This section illustrates how to add drivers for Windows 10 through an example in which you want to import Windows 10 drivers for the HP EliteBook 8560w model.

segment.source: For the purposes of this section, we assume that you have downloaded the Windows 10 drivers for the HP EliteBook 8560w model and copied them to the E:SourcesOSDDriverSourcesWindows 10 x64HP EliteBook 8560w folder on CM01.
segment.target: For the purposes of this section, we assume that you have downloaded the Windows 10 drivers for the HP EliteBook 8560w model and copied them to the E:SourcesOSDDriverSourcesWindows 10 x64HP EliteBook 8560w folder on CM01.

segment.source: On CM01, using the Configuration Manager Console, right-click the Drivers folder and select Import Driver.
segment.target: On CM01, using the Configuration Manager Console, right-click the Drivers folder and select Import Driver.

segment.source: In the Import New Driver Wizard, on the Specify a location to import driver page, below the Import all drivers in the following network path (UNC) option, browse to the CM01Sources$OSDDriverSourcesWindows 10 x64HP EliteBook 8560w folder and click Next.
segment.target: In the Import New Driver Wizard, on the Specify a location to import driver page, below the Import all drivers in the following network path (UNC) option, browse to the CM01Sources$OSDDriverSourcesWindows 10 x64HP EliteBook 8560w folder and click Next.

segment.source: On the Specify the details for the imported driver page, click Categories, create a category named Windows 10 x64 - HP EliteBook 8560w, and then click Next.
segment.target: On the Specify the details for the imported driver page, click Categories, create a category named Windows 10 x64 - HP EliteBook 8560w, and then click Next.

segment.source: figure 22
segment.target: figure 22

segment.source: Figure 22.
segment.target: Figure 22.

segment.source: Create driver categories.
segment.target: Create driver categories.

segment.source: On the Select the packages to add the imported driver page, click New Package, use the following settings for the package, and then click Next:
segment.target: On the Select the packages to add the imported driver page, click New Package, use the following settings for the package, and then click Next:

segment.source: Name: Windows 10 x64 - HP EliteBook 8560w
segment.target: Name: Windows 10 x64 - HP EliteBook 8560w

segment.source: Path: CM01Sources$OSDDriverPackagesWindows 10 x64HP EliteBook 8560w
segment.target: Path: CM01Sources$OSDDriverPackagesWindows 10 x64HP EliteBook 8560w

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: The package path does not yet exist, so you have to type it in.
segment.target: The package path does not yet exist, so you have to type it in.

segment.source: The wizard will create the new package in that folder.
segment.target: The wizard will create the new package in that folder.

segment.source: On the Select drivers to include in the boot image page, do not select anything, and click Next twice.
segment.target: On the Select drivers to include in the boot image page, do not select anything, and click Next twice.

segment.source: After the package has been created, click Close.
segment.target: After the package has been created, click Close.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: If you want to monitor the driver import process more closely, you can open the SMSProv.log file during driver import.
segment.target: If you want to monitor the driver import process more closely, you can open the SMSProv.log file during driver import.

segment.source: figure 23
segment.target: figure 23

segment.source: Figure 23.
segment.target: Figure 23.

segment.source: Drivers imported and a new driver package created.
segment.target: Drivers imported and a new driver package created.
